list_definition.definition: a person whose job is to (collect and) deliver letters etc; mailman American

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Has the postman been this morning yet?

list_ex_of_english: We have talked in terms of having the best and cheapest postal service in the world, claiming that our postmen are wonderful—and they are.
The house-to-house delivery has been suspended, with the concurrence of the parish council, in order to afford the postmen a weekly half holiday.
Auxiliary postmen, engaged for such duties, are clearly warned in writing on first employment that they have no title to succeed to established posts.
In rural areas postmen carry stamps with them, which may be purchased on their rounds.
I will make inquiry as to the stripe adjustments in the case of postmen at the offices mentioned.
Temporary postmen do not receive a separate allowance for boots.
I should perhaps say postpeople, as nowadays there are as many postwomen as postmen.
I refer to the service of assistant postmen.
